document_data.name: Setara bint Aasim
document_data.mainbody: '''Setara bint Aasim''' was a money-changer living in [[Hawa]] in the [[1367 DR|Year of the Shield, 1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}<ref group="note">It is possible that there are two people with the same name, but because the timelines do not overlap and there are no obvious contradictions, it is assumed that these two publications refer to the same person until proven otherwise.
document_data.Description: Setara was an attractive woman, and she would openly flirt with men to gain information.
document_data.Activities:
Setara's money-changing business was merely a front to mask her true purpose for the [[Cult of Istishia|Cult of]] [[Istishia]] as a [[holy slayer]] for the [[Dark Wave]]. Setara would flash a special coin used by the cult for recognition by their members. If anyone wished to keep the coin they would be marked for assassination. She also made note of solitary children roaming the market, targeting them for kidnapping.

In Waterdeep, she bought the [[Marblehearth]] rental villa on the north spur of [[Mount Waterdeep|the mountain]] and converted it into a festhall that quickly gained popularity around the city.
document_data.Relationships:
Setara was the sister of her fellow Dark Wave members [[Shadha]] and [[Sahlah]].<ref>

She made an enemy in Rokkek Ingerr by taking control of his business. He wallowed in self-pity but looked for ways to have her assassinated.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: A rumor circulated around Waterdeep that Setara had two [[genies]] for servants.
